for_sales.sales_text: Bess' is a 14’ wooden clinker open dayboat gaff sloop, built in 1947 by Eversons of Woodbridge. Foresail on bowsprit withWykeham-Martin roller reefing. She is kept on a swinging mooring at Slaughden Quay, Suffolk in the summer and returns to our home garage for winter maintenance and storage. Over boom cover and both sails in excellent condition. New centre board case, some doubling and interior shell blasted back to bare wood 2019. Now fully prepared for the Season. Road trailer with new bearings and seals 2018. Not been in water since. Mercury 3.5hp only about 6hrs of use. All equipment included. 3 wheel launching trolley could be available.

boat.full_description:
'Bess' is a 14' a varnished mahoghany clinker open boaty, constructed in 1947 by Eversons of Woodbridge. Little of her history is known prior to 2016. In 2019 she joined in with her first OGA event with the East Coast Gaffers.

Can anyone help to shed light on her earlier years?
boat.name: Bess
boat.short_description: 'Bess' is a 14’, clinker hulled open boat built in 1947. She is kept on a swinging mooring at Slaughden, Suffolk in the summer and returns to a garage for the winter. Major overhaul Everson's, Aldeburgh and self 2019-20.
